website_summaries.verdict: If you have multiple people gaming and streaming on your Wi-Fi network, you can’t top the speed, range, and secure connection of this model.
pros: Easily sends HD content to multiple devices at once
Works with all major cable providers
cons: One of the priciest cable modem-router combos available

customer_reviews.title: It's an Edsel
customer_reviews.text: I cannot recommend against this modem strongly enough. Both my original one and the warranty replacement had defective coaxial ports, which have caused me several hours of frustration to the point where I almost broke down in tears as I repeatedly tried and failed to fix it — and I don't cry easily. I'm a freaking college-educated programmer with professional IT experience, and even I couldn't get these pieces of crap to work. I can't believe Netgear's quality control is so awful that two modems in a row ($430 modems, no less) were duds. Imagine charging half a grand for a product that you don't even engineer correctly! tl;dr trash. It's trash. No better than an expensive paperweight.
customer_reviews.author: Vivian

customer_reviews.title: I love my C7800...
customer_reviews.text: I love my C7800, SO MANY OPTIONS!!! I'm such a happy camper... Why I love it: WIFI RANGE IS INSANE! No repeaters needed Can create OWN cloud services (http and FTP accessible) as large as USB drive allows Performs as Media Server Allows hidden SSID Can disable any additional connections Many more options that I have yet to play with Other models Alexa compatibility Cloud Storage CAUTION Be aware of 2nd hand equipment being sold as new. The manufacturer will be able to tell you if you have a used or refurbished item. The first one I bought apparently was. It is well worth the cost.
customer_reviews.author: DarlingNikkiGATop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working after 2 months
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this modem/router when I upgraded my cable subscription to 1G. It worked great for about a month then I started noticing it drops certain devices after a few hours of heavy traffic from my home. I have spent another month working with different router configurations but to no avail, it still randomly drops connections both wired and wireless. The only way to fix this is to reboot the router, but now that I need to do this every 20 minutes it no longer makes sense to use this device. I am very disappointed. I read some similar reviews but purchased anyway, my mistake.
customer_reviews.author: PetiteFlower

customer_reviews.title: Extremely Disappointed (Caveat)
customer_reviews.text: Onboarding is horrid, worst admin ui/ux ever...you'd have to be a speed demon to get any settings updated/customized, or the security pin demon will slap you silly. Did I mention worst setup ever? Had to jump from Chrome to Safari (due to repeated password entry even when ALL extensions are off)...then had to try multiple DNS servers to get it talking to the ISP. Oh I honestly doubt the experience of the software team. Was so looking forward to it from various online reviews. So so extremely disappointed. However, with my loyalty to the company, I'm giving them a 2 star. If signals is iffy within the next 3 days, so returning the product, and dropping to 1 star.
customer_reviews.author: Hanns

customer_reviews.title: Works great, not very customizable.
customer_reviews.text: The only reason this doesn't get 4 stars is because the genie just isn't up to par, especially for a Netgear product. Devices on the network can't be prioritized, which is a disappointment. The overall speed and performance, however, is wonderful. I haven't had to reset once since installing. If you have a house full of devices and want hassle-free, hands-off management, then this is a good solution.
customer_reviews.author: John F. Murray

customer_reviews.title: Modem/router in a single device
customer_reviews.text: I just installed the Netgear CAX80 modem/router and it works fine. Always check with your ISP to verify this device is certified to work on their network.
customer_reviews.author: Guy Tingos

customer_reviews.title: Good. Needs work
customer_reviews.text: Got this as I'm huge a huge fan of 2-in-1 units and it was time to replace my old Netgear combo unit. Setup was smooth, however after few hours of streaming the video quality became degraded. I went into the admin portal of the router and saw that somehow the unit lowered the wifi transmit rate. Manually changed, same issue after, again and again. I feel the early units need some more work with the firmware. Will repurchase in few months after firmware bugs are worked out. Stay away for now
customer_reviews.author: Stanley L.

customer_reviews.title: It Works Fantastically from the Get Go!
customer_reviews.text: I tried 2 other DOCSIS 3.1 cable modems, one with a wifi router, and the installation was difficult and ultimately did not work except in the case of one of them where the wifi signal was detected briefly and then never again no matter what I did to get it to work. I also use a VOIP telephone and a link to it was never established even though it was connected directly by an Ethernet cable. In contrast the Netgear Nighthawk Cable Modem Wifi Router Combo (C7800) worked perfectly and the signal was easily detected and links connected to all devices in this 2 story home. Fantastic!
customer_reviews.author: Richard P. Caro

customer_reviews.title: Worth the upgrade but at a high cost
customer_reviews.text: Superb modem router combo! Finally decided to get a docsis 3.1 setup and this will be great for a few years to come as our devices now get to catch up. Setup was easy through the app with our xfinity service. It's sleek looking and really does a good job managing our smart devices. The speed and throughput is fantastic in our home so we'll see how well it holds up over time. Only downside is the cost but I won't knock it for value since this is the latest and greatest. You gotta pay to play sometimes or look somewhere else.
customer_reviews.author: M. Tsang

customer_reviews.title: Purchasing for Xfinity??? Save yourself some heartache and move on
customer_reviews.text: Like others have said this modem worked with Xfinity...for a finite amount of time. One day, I’m guessing after some updates from Xfinity, my $375 modem stopped working properly. Did I mention I spent $375 on this thing. It will not keep a signal from the provider for more then a couple hours. I’ve researched this problem extensively and their are some real techy things going on that prevents this $375 modem to work properly with Xfinity that I won’t get into but take my word for it, or better yet, investigate yourself. Just dont do it AFTER the fact. I’m so pissed I’m leaving, Netgear AND Xfinity. FIOS don’t let me down!
customer_reviews.author: Tyrone S.

customer_reviews.title: MODEM SUCKS NEVER PURCHASE
customer_reviews.text: THIS MODEM DOES NOT WORK WITH MY ISP, COMPLETELY SUCKS, NEVER NEVER NEVER NEVER NEVER NEVER NEVER PURCHASE THIS MODEM YOU HAVE BEEN WARNED WASTE OF TIME, NEVER NEVER NEVER NEVER NEVER AGAIN, NEVER!!!!! MAC ADDRESS WAS ON MY ACCOUNT, STILL DID NOT WORK, NEVER PURCHASE THIS MODEM NEVER AGAIN! YOU HAVE BEEN WARNED! MODEM IS A POS! GUARANTEED NOT TO GET YOU ONLINE, NET-GEAR YOU SUCK!
customer_reviews.author: Dean

customer_reviews.title: Delivers Cox Gigablast Gig Speed via Ethernet to PC using MS Edge
customer_reviews.text: After much troubleshooting the choking of the speed was found to be relate to running speed testing under Google Chrome due to unwanted extensions issues. The NetGear C7800 modem/router received the Gigablast signal and delivered it at 920 mbps using speed testing under the MS Edge browser. Chrome choked the speed doe to a best of 450 to 500 mbps after nearly all of the extensions were disabled.
customer_reviews.author: Scott T

customer_reviews.title: Best Cable modem I have every seen...
customer_reviews.text: This CAX80 is everything they said it was. I'm running 1gbps service. I have a very difficult automated home to cover with 60+ devices. My Laptop hits 800mbps+ on the 3rd floor of my home. 760mbps on my 4th floor deck.. My Nighthawk CAX80 is on the 1st floor. It works very hard to get a signal to the 3rd floor signal strength was still a respectable 60% with 53dBm. As of a few days ago I have added a Nighthawk EX8000 now I have 97-100% signal strength everywhere 31-41dBm.
customer_reviews.author: Chad Singleton

customer_reviews.title: Excellent modem/router with great wi-fi coverage
customer_reviews.text: I love this modem/router. I needed to replace my outdated modem/router. I also needed to expand the reach of my wi-fi signal. This modem/router has met and exceeded my expectations. Set-up was extremely easy and intuitive. The only slightly negative thing for me is that the housing and antennae take up significantly more room than my old modem/router and it doesn't come with a stand so I could stand it on end in order to take up less room. I definitely recommend this modem/router combo.
customer_reviews.author: amazprime

customer_reviews.title: Buyer beware..........
customer_reviews.text: Our “new” item arrived as a “refurbished” unit. It was scratched and not completely sealed. Was unable to get it to send a signal to any of our devices in our house. Had the cable company come to try to connect - they weren’t able. Netgear support was good - and they weren’t able to get it to connect either. Completely upset because we waited to open it until our new TV arrived. Now, since we’re out of the 30day return window (because we waited on the new TV) and probably won’t be able to get a complete refund on an item that was broken before it even arrived at our house.
customer_reviews.author: my bougie

customer_reviews.title: Very large, but better range than expected
customer_reviews.text: I now get a strong 5G signal around my entire house (about 1800 sq ft), much better than the Netgear C6300 router I owned previously. I have it centrally located on the main floor, and I can reach both the upstairs and downstairs and outside very well. I was not expecting the router to be as large as it was, but that must help the range.
customer_reviews.author: girliegurl

customer_reviews.title: The Best WiFi 6 & DOCSIS 3.1 Cable Modem/Router PERIOD!
customer_reviews.text: I started new service in Missouri and Spectrum had the CAX80 as one of their recommended "Bring Your Own" modems, and even though the price tag was a bit more than I would have normally been comfortable with, reading the reviews from others just made it too easy to pick this gem. I also purchased the Netgear Nighthawk Whole Home Mesh WiFi 6 System, 3-Pack thinking that I'd need those APs to cover our new home (over 4,000 Sq/ft between 2 floors), but the signal of the CAX80 was actually pretty amazing even far away (not 100% but good enough for mobile WiFI). I'm VERY HAPPY with this purchase, and would highly recommend it to anyone!
customer_reviews.author: Robert G.

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install, great range
customer_reviews.text: Installed this in about 20 minutes and we get great signal all throughout our home (3000 sq ft, 3 levels). We have it on the main floor and reaches the basement with no problems, as well as the upstairs. Originally, I bought a Nighthawk modem and router (separately) and returned them for this all in one as it was less failure points and troubleshooting when that time comes.
customer_reviews.author: C. Williamson

customer_reviews.title: You will need to contact your ISP for connection.
customer_reviews.text: This is one of the best router/modems out there. Dual-band is perfect for HD streaming with multiple devices, and the ability to connect 45 different devices is great for smart devices like Alexa and smart lights and whatnot. You may need to contact your ISP to get it connected to the web but its not a huge feat. A simple call to Cox and I was running in no time. Physical set up is even easier, but it is a larger router. Roughly the size of a college textbook for calculus or chemistry. You may want to consider wall mounting it or getting a designated shelf for it.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: absolute terrible customer service. my wife was on hold for two hours just to get put on hold more.
customer_reviews.text: i could not get the Ethernet to work, only the wireless. customer service was no help to us at all, they just kept asking numbers on the box and putting us on hold. i will be returning posthaste. i would not recommend this product because of the customer service. while the WiFi is working fine still no support to get the hard line working, and still on hold.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy summerfield

customer_reviews.title: Great All-In-One
customer_reviews.text: The Router/Modem is everything I expected- 2.4 and 5g frequencies. the range is good without having to connect any kind of mesh or boosters. Two negatives, but not deal breakers is the size of the unit- its bigger than I expected. 2nd when I do a speed test it takes a few seconds to output the correct and steady speeds almost like throttling up. Those are minor gripes and would highly recommend this to anyone looking for a 1GBPS down without the hassle of having to buy a separate router.
customer_reviews.author: J Walk

customer_reviews.title: Pricey but worth every Penny I Promise
customer_reviews.text: What more can I say Hands down the Best Modem Router on the market . This thing has all the new bells and whistles you can ask for in 2020 . DOCSIS3.1 WI-FI 6 a 1.5 GHz processor. Nighthawk app is also very useful . A must have for a connected household.
customer_reviews.author: Devon

customer_reviews.title: Stay away
customer_reviews.text: This router is a beast when it works. To bad it constantly drops signal. And let me tell you. It will! You cans even be hard lined and it will drop internet connection for a split second( long enough for your device to notice) Look when it works it’s great, blazing speeds. But when it doesn’t I want to smash it against the wall. At 300 dollars this thing should have zero problems. Money can’t save you .. Go figure . Would not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Nick S.

customer_reviews.title: RUN AWAY FROM THIS
customer_reviews.text: The product worked fine for approximately one month. All of a sudden I didn’t have Internet again. I called Xfinity who ran some diagnostics and said it was a problem with Netgear. I was on the phone with Netgear for approximately an hour and they said it was Comcast fault. Going back to Xfinity they determined that it was Netgear’s problem. Save yourself a huge headache and nightmare and DO NOT BUY THIS. Customer service and tech-support at Netgear was incredibly horrible as well. Thank goodness Amazon was actually very good and taking this back. I will never buy another Netgear product again
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Brown

customer_reviews.title: Works Wonderfully  and tech support was amazing!
customer_reviews.text: This modem router is an excellent product. I had difficulties setting it up and called tech support. They were excellent! We stayed on the phone for awhile and did everything possible to resolve the problem. There was no problem on the router's end. I had to call Spectrum and let them know that I had another modem. It was not connected to my account! LOL NOW, everything works wonderfully! Computers come right on, streaming is super fast, cell phones, tablets, everything is working beautifully! Thank you Netgear!! You're AMAZING!
customer_reviews.author: 4EverExquisite Jewelry Maker

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny!
customer_reviews.text: Here have you been all my life? By Mama Llama 12345 With “distance learning” we have five chrome books, seven cell phones that must be on WiFi because we are in the hills, and several computers, gaming and iPads, we struggled with lagging and dropped connections.... until this bad boy right here! So happy with the speeds for multiple devices. Even wireless we pull over 250 regularly! Yay!
customer_reviews.author: MamaLlama

customer_reviews.title: Easy set-up. Works great with Xfinity. Fine for 3000 Sq Ft. home. All devices connected. Fast!
customer_reviews.text: I have been using Netgear equip for many years and I never have any problems at all. This was an easy set-up, but you will have to clear your browsers first to connect. This does not work with bundles where voice is included. A computer restart will allow the browsers to work as well if it shows connected to the network, but not to the internet. Or select "new private window" on the browser. Full 5 stars for sure unless it dies or something unexpected.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis Schmahl

customer_reviews.title: Well worth the money!
customer_reviews.text: I bought the CAX80 to future proof my house. I was really worried the cost would outweigh the future benefits, but I was wrong! It was very easy to setup, but with 3-5 min wait times for the firmware to update. Once the firmware was updated, I was amazed at the range and performance of CAX80! Awesome for streaming, gaming to everyday networking, this router is choice! Well worth the price of admission!
customer_reviews.author: itr81

customer_reviews.title: Check your speeds
customer_reviews.text: After trouble shooting all my equipment and having the Cox technician come out to check their stuff, it was determined that it was the router/modem combo. We were getting 1000 down from the cable and also when straight hard wired into equipment we got 1000 down with another modem in place. When we introduced this modem/router combo into the equation the download speeds got cut in half. I wouldn't recommend this piece of equipment to anyone attempting to get more than 500 down and 35 up.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Great wired speeds, bad Wi-Fi speeds
customer_reviews.text: This modem is a mixed bag for me. I have a 1 Gig speed internet, so it works pretty good on the wired connection, delivering up to 1Gbps speeds on my PC and my Xbox. However, on my wireless devices it barely cracks 200Mbps on 5G. I was getting close to 650Mbps on my Xfinity gateway over Wi-Fi. I haven't yet decided whether I'm going to keep this modem yet.
customer_reviews.author: Rumyn

customer_reviews.title: Condition doesn't match Amazon warehouse description
customer_reviews.text: Great modem router but not from Amazon warehouse!!! Want to purchase a certified renewed modem and found that modem that I received not working as supposed to. Probably this is was the original problem with this modem why it was returned or sold back to Amazon. Due having a mid range internet speed was able to discover the issue with this unit. Having a 300mb internet speed from Xfinity was able to receive only 220-230mb with wired connection and wifi was around 110-140mb Spend two hours with Xfinity and Netgear support team and they told me that there is some issue with the modem/router and it will be better to returned it back to Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Guy Portnov

customer_reviews.title: Works with Mediacom in Burlington, IA
customer_reviews.text: Took a chance and ordered it. I can confirm it DOES work with Mediacom in Burlington, IA. I pay for 1GB with Mediacom and even when I was hard wire connected with the modem/router I rented from them the best I could get was around 350mbs. On wifi the best I could get was about 50mbs around my house. Now with the Nighthawk I can get 350mbs on Wifi when I'm near the router/modem and about 200mbps around my house. You decide if that's worth it to you.
customer_reviews.author: Tooth

customer_reviews.title: got it fixed
customer_reviews.text: Edited review, bumping up to 4 stars. Finally got the device working with the ISP - turns out the unit was not at fault but was in fact more powerful and that in turn highlighted an issue on my ISPs network. After they replaced some items street side, the unit is working as intended.
customer_reviews.author: Richard

customer_reviews.title: Issue with the status of the Product
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install. HOWEVER, the status of the product is questionable. i have no way to know if the product i received is new or refurbished. i knew i paid for a new product but i found there were existing username, password, and security questions when i was setting up the product. The Netgear Tech couldn't tell me the product status instead warned me of the seller i bought. We ended up reset the router, this leaving me to question the security of the product and the status of the product. i paid for a new item and definitely didn't want to get a refurbished items.
customer_reviews.author: Jack

customer_reviews.title: Netgear Nighthawk Cable-modem
customer_reviews.text: The installation was routine and easy; the Nighthawk was up and running within 15 minutes. Above, I did not rate the Tech Support because I have needed none so far (about four months after purchase) and do not expect to need any over the lifetime of the product. I do have to reset the cable-modem about once a week, but I do not know if this is the cable-modem or our local franchise (we are in a rural community without access to a nationally-known cable company). Other than that, the Nighthawk is fulfilling my family's needs in a satisfactory manner.
customer_reviews.author: JayArr

customer_reviews.title: Great choice
customer_reviews.text: Bought this because I was upgrading to Cox Gigablast and my prior Nighthawk modem wouldn’t support that speed. Range isn’t quite as good on 5Ghz network as the old modem but wired connection is hitting gig speed, 5Ghz wireless is about 330 mbps and 2.4 is low 100’s which is expected. I like that I can control the lights on it, that’s kinda cool ;-)
customer_reviews.author: Michael Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing
customer_reviews.text: So, this unit does not even remotely live up to the signal coverage as advertised. Just keep that in mind. I have a modern home, no concrete, minimal obstructions, 2500 SQFT and I can barely get a signal upstairs
customer_reviews.author: Clarence Wittwer

customer_reviews.title: From Pinto to Cadillac
customer_reviews.text: Great decision finally made to upgrade - you do have to engage your Internet Provider (in my case Cox) and they need to do some configurations on their end which did take over 30 min), but the smart tech guy on the phone is the one that stated the headline, and I'm certain he sees his share of upgrades! I'm very Happy, family is happy, we are speeding along!
customer_reviews.author: William F Farmer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent router/modem combo.  Very impressed
customer_reviews.text: This thing is great! We are getting about 15% faster speeds than we were before, with a modem connected to a seperate wifi router. Lag is also quicker, so clicking on webpages is noticeably faster, which is really even more important than the download speed improvement. Very good device, my only minor wish/complaint is that it let you view all web traffic passing through the router, there is no option to do that. But other than that, very good Docsis 3.1 modem/router. The wifi signal is very strong also, you wont need to have extenders or boosters to get your signal to all parts of the house.
customer_reviews.author: B. Loomis

customer_reviews.title: Works with WOW! ISP
customer_reviews.text: We bought this due to the stock WOW! router/modem combo being insufficient for what we needed and having issues reaching the speeds we are paying for. We had to call our ISP and have them activate service with the new Netgear router/modem combo in order for us to use it, however the phone call wasn't too bad. We haven't had any issues since.
customer_reviews.author: Nic

customer_reviews.title: Wireless speeds are slower than the Comcast modem/WiFi unit:(
customer_reviews.text: The Ethernet ports are super quick and it has a number of good functions. Even though it is a Nighthawk unit you cannot use the Nighthawk app on my phone. Instead I have to use the genie app which is no longer updated. Had I known this I would have bought a modem and WiFi unit separately to allow me to use the better app. I have also noticed that on my 500 Mb/s connection I cannot get that speed through the wireless. It does have two usb 3 ports for storage and a printer to allow anyone on the network to access. That being said it is still a nice unit and really easy to set up.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Van Houtte

customer_reviews.title: It's WoWFi6, not WiFi 6
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install, doubled download speed on my Galaxy Note10+ and my WiFi5 devices. Don't like the fact that you can't change the default admin username. You can change the default admin password, however I feel that hacking would be harder if you could change both.
customer_reviews.author: J. Moore

customer_reviews.title: Should have listened to the other reviewers
customer_reviews.text: I wish I would have listened to the other reviewers about how awful this modem is. Connection would keep dropping (wireless and wired) that would require a complete reboot every day. Reached out to their customer support for assistance. Long story short their solutions did not work which resulted in them sending me a refurbished router... Which I find insulting since I paid full price to not have a refurbished model. Save yourself 300 bucks and stay away from this modem
customer_reviews.author: DD726

customer_reviews.title: One of my worst decisions
customer_reviews.text: Buying a used modem or WIFI is a BIG MISTAKE! Could not register with NETGEAR because prior owner was listed. Once resolved the 90 days of free support had expired so they wanted to SELL me a 1 or 2 year program for several hundred $$: DIDN'T purchase either. Once installed our smart phone apps didn't work, internet access declined in quality. Returned it to Amazon after 2 days. Conversely, purchased a new NETGEAR C700v2 from BB; less $$, half hour to install and EVERYTHING WORKS GREAT! NO more gently reused digital communication stuff from AMAZON in our home!
customer_reviews.author: RonJaeger

customer_reviews.title: I need to be contacted about my return
customer_reviews.text: Product wouldn’t connect to the internet, got tired of dealing with all the different tech helps, returned it two weeks ago and still waiting on my return money. Ups says it was delivered back to amazon 7 business days ago. I want my money back. And no do t buy this refurbished piece of crap
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: nice but did not work long for me
customer_reviews.text: Had several issues when it would get stop working. talk to support 4-5 times and finally we gave up and she said I should return it as faulty equipment. Not sure that it was faulty or actually just plain lousy product. I usually have pretty good luck and performance with Netgear, just not with this particular product. Combo products generally do not perform as well as 2 good quality separate ones.
customer_reviews.author: bob boulris

customer_reviews.title: It’s says NEW PRODUCTS!!! Lies!!!!
customer_reviews.text: This is the second unit I purchased in 3 days. The first unit couldn’t link up with Xfinity. The MAC code was under a previous account. Couldn’t get ahold of netgear to resolve the problem. I purchased another new unit and the same exact thing happened again. The “new” units are not new. You pay top dollar for this product and both were not NEW!!!! After 7 hrs of hell with the cable company, aggravated, and exhausted I returned both products. Never again buying a modem router from Amazon again!!!
customer_reviews.author: John Totton

customer_reviews.title: Great range.
customer_reviews.text: I installed this a few months ago. My old one gave me a dead spot in my laundry. No more dead spots now. I also get a great signal by the pool and down my entire driveway. I have it plugged into a surge suppressor/battery backup so it stays on even when the power goes out. My husband is able to live stream sports without any issues.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Hollywood

customer_reviews.title: Broken Right Out of the Box (Obviously Used)
customer_reviews.text: This modem is 100% garbage. Upon setup, it refused to accept the default username and password. Tried to do a factory reset and the reset button is broken. Why would a brand new modem not have the factory settings and why would the reset already be broken? Item was purchased as a late Christmas present, didn't get a chance to attempt a setup until late January, the return window is closed, so I just bought my husband a $300 cheap plastic paperweight for Christmas. Avoid this cheaply made garbage at all costs and if you do pick one up, try to install it right away so you don't get screwed like we did.
customer_reviews.author: Jacklyn R. Tennyson

customer_reviews.title: Great Device!
customer_reviews.text: A great cable modem/WiFi router. Sure beats what the cable company has. Easy to set up, follow the simple instructions and no tech support is needed! Great signal on WiFi! We’ve had no service issues since we bought this device. You can’t go wrong when you get one of these.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen Hare

customer_reviews.title: 3-2-1- We Have Liftoff........
customer_reviews.text: Fast Fast Fast.....a rocket-ship. A little bigger than expected....but meh...who cares. So far so good. And simple to install with Xfinity. After having to go all over the place to re-connect devices (Ring Doorbell, Echo Dot, Nest Thermostat, Smart TVs, phones, laptops, kindles and wireless printers (whew...).......we are all set and everything is FAST all over the house.
customer_reviews.author: Wayne

customer_reviews.title: Voice calls via my iPhone set to use Wi-fi calling has one-way audio
customer_reviews.text: I replaced my Xfinity router for this one. The set up was relatively easy and my son could keep gaming, and I had no issues in my three story house to get signal, but since I have poor cellular at my house most if not all my calls are set up to go over wi-fi. Most my calls using this method were fine on the Xfinity router, but now with this one and there being no QoS setting, my calls typically only have one way audio. How to fix this is baffling me? My older Netgear router prior to the Xfinity one also did not exhibit this behavior, albeit it had a QoS setting as well. Any thoughts?
customer_reviews.author: R. Moses

customer_reviews.title: Resold product being sold as new
customer_reviews.text: Be careful when buying this product. I got a returned unit but on Amazon it didn’t say anything about being refurbished and said it was new. Worked great for 2 weeks then it became defective and was not able to broadcast any kind of WiFi signal nor was the hardwire working. Both had previously been working flawlessly. Called my ISP and everything was working on their end and then I called Netgear support and they told me that someone had already registered my exact product a month before I had bought it. It was then returned by that customer but sold to me as a new product. Very disappointed and will be returning and buying this product elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Big, Overpriced, Unreliable, a Waste of time and Money.
customer_reviews.text: Worked great for about 2 days. I was satisfied with the speed and impressed with the range of this model until it began to constantly drop internet connection. Each time it disconnected a reboot of the unit was required after which all was well for a few hours. I reconnected the cable modem this one was to replace, a three year old Netgear Nighthawk, and have not had a problem since.
customer_reviews.author: JWash1

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy terrible product terrible support
customer_reviews.text: Had this thing for 6 months went to play some Xbox no connectivity. Ran diagnostics was getting 15-45% packet loss. Isolated most of the problem to the 2.4g radio throwing packet collisions and just locking up the whole router. Contacted Netgear they wanted me to pay for troubleshooting when I wanted an RMA finally got them to issue one tech on the phone promised a NEW router got a refurb with even worse issues. Since they refuse to do anything they get one star. DO NOT BUY.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: No parental controls available on the router!!
customer_reviews.text: Difficult to get configured with Comcast. OpenDNS parental controls have been discontinued even though it's documented as available in the manual. Disney Circle parental controls are also not available even though the admin app at 192.168.0.1 pop up a browser window for the Circle site. Confirmed with NetGear Tech Support.
customer_reviews.author: stock4166

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY! BUYER BEWARE!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought the router and had connection issues. By the time xfinity worked out that it was on my side it was to late to return product. SO I called netgear and was told the only help I could get was if I PAID mor emoney to get PRO-Support. I paid and got two year extended support.....Well it looks like I will need every bit of support I can get. They sent me a replacement unit and any guess, yeah it didn't work either. I called and they are sending yet another unit. I will never buy another Netgear product for the rest of life. This issue has cost me 50+hours from my life. Hopefully the next unit works..
customer_reviews.author: Adam C.

customer_reviews.title: Easy setup High Performance
customer_reviews.text: Easy setup and faster speed than my subscription can throw at it. I had it up and running with a slave router providing coverage throughout the house and pool area in about an hour. No problem streaming 4K content. The router saves $13 over renting from Xfinity and with a Roku box replaces the satellite TV box. It won’t take long for this to pay back its cost on rental savings alone. Performance is next-gen and beyond my current needs. I get a little more bandwidth than I pay for.
customer_reviews.author: Cirquerider

customer_reviews.title: If you have a smart home, you must own this.
customer_reviews.text: Apart from the usual devices (like TV, phones, laptops and iPad) if you have a smart home setup like Alexa, smart bulbs, smart switches, doorbell, cameras etc, then this is the modem / router you must buy. For a long time I had the issue of my cameras going offline almost once in every 2 days. Then I decided to return the internet service provider's modem / router and purchased this one. Things have changed now. No more offline devices. Great internet speed over WiFi. And WiFi range is very good.
customer_reviews.author: RS

customer_reviews.title: Excellent WiFi coverage
customer_reviews.text: I was having lots of trouble with my previous cable modem so I purchased this one. With 1800 square feet of space in my home, the old unit would not broadcast the WiFi signal to all areas of my home consistently. This Netgear modem solved all my problems. It was a bit expensive, but now I do not have dropped signals to my devices via WiFi. It was definitely worth every penny I spent!
customer_reviews.author: Bret

customer_reviews.title: Not for Spectrum 1G> plans
customer_reviews.text: We got this combo because we needed a faster modem/router combo since we upgraded our Spectrum plan to the 1G plan. However, the Spectrum technician who came to install and later the tech support we called stated that for the 1G plan, Spectrum does not allow combo modem/routers. We were forced to use the Spectrum modem which they said is free for the 1G plan... We will be returning his modem.
customer_reviews.author: Sergio O. Parreiras

customer_reviews.title: Very slow WIFI, very dissappointed.
customer_reviews.text: Advertised as up to 1600mps wifi speed, higher with ethernet. Cable internet installer set it up, tested it with his wired equipment, cable was providing around 900mps. WIFI, 200 MAX. We tried the cable tech support, then I spent several hours on the phone with Netgear tech support, 2 different times. Both support people gave me instructions, then told me to hang up, wait 1 hour, and it would work as advertised. Never happened. Terribly disappointed. Cannot recommend this at all.
customer_reviews.author: RDVC

customer_reviews.title: Do Not Buy! Spend Your Money On ANY Other Modem/Router!
customer_reviews.text: Do not buy this product if you have an internet package faster than 200Mbps! I’ve had nothing but issues with this. On the good days that it’s actually working, you can only get about 200Mbps out of it (despite having a faster internet package). But more often than not, it loses the signal and you have to reset it. Spent way too much time going in circles with my internet provider & with Netgear and there’s nothing they can do to fix this. In my honest opinion, this is a waste of money and you’re far better off buying ANYTHING other than this.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Mead

customer_reviews.title: The best of the best
customer_reviews.text: This is the king of WiFi routers. The high end version is needed for gigabit internet service. I am able to get xfinity gigabit and it’s amazing. This router does get gigabit. Well as close as I can measure. On devices hard-wired into it with Ethernet I’ve gotten around 950Mbps using Speedtest. You can turn off the lights through the device admin webpage. I recommend that if you have it out in the open because it uses a lot of blue LEDs.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Rose

customer_reviews.title: Speed Matters
customer_reviews.text: First I want to say lightning speed! Since installing our new Nighthawk our former speeds on Xfinity have doubled! Using the Nighthawk App made the installation so easy. Checking my network speed is so simple from the app and it performs it multiple times to ensure your connection is solid. We were struggling with a good signal in a two story home with a family room in the basement. No longer as our speeds are consistent across platforms from streaming to gameplay. If you are wondering is it worth the cost - it is pricey but worth eliminating our inconsistency we had previously.
customer_reviews.author: Randy Mosier

customer_reviews.title: Serious Speed Boost
customer_reviews.text: Replaced my AC1900 with this router - Xfinity setup took over 20 minutes but we have been getting blazing fast speeds since then. Having used multiple Netgear routers before, the interface is simple and easy to use. Highly recommend this little monster. The horizontal profile makes it less visible but does not impact signal strength. If you don't like the LEDs on the antennas, you can turn them off.
customer_reviews.author: Houston Cricket

customer_reviews.title: Signal Drops Out
customer_reviews.text: Setup with dual band and an EX8000 mesh extender to support multiple devices and extend signal to my back patio; connections dropping all over the place. I have new Sonos move speakers. Always cutting in and out. Tried going single band, focused on 5GHz; seemed to work well at first . Good performance in my BY. Then the speakers quit & signal went out on the extender. Assumed an extender issue. Turns out the WiFi dropped out altogether; All lights were lit on the modem, but the SSID was not visible from any device. The 5GHz signal was gone. Been through the process of selecting different channels, moved the modem. Xfinity xb6 modem was more dependable.
customer_reviews.author: Megan

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful! It fixed what was ailing us.
customer_reviews.text: For months I have been dealing with internet issues. We have around 6 devices, and keep getting lag/disconnects. This machine actually puts out the gb/s, and today is the first day since I moved here that the internet hasn't been an "issue". Thank you netgear! PS The only complaint is the way it was shipped. You got really lucky when shipping it without a box!
customer_reviews.author: Matt B

customer_reviews.title: Works like a charm after a 45m call with Comcast
customer_reviews.text: I love this router so far. It works as it should with good speeds. PSA, this is not a "Plug and play". A lot of people complained that it wouldn't work and I had trouble with it as well. The problem people don't realize is that when you change your *modem*, you have to call your ISP and tell them to activate it. Typically, you'd have a modem and router separate so you just change the router and its plug and play. Since this is a two-in-one solution, you have to call your ISP in order to authorize the modem and it will work. This router modem combo is the best so far.
customer_reviews.author: Sandeep Vuriti

customer_reviews.title: not compatible
customer_reviews.text: spent a few hours trying to get this set up with cox when they advised me they will not be approving a product that meets all of the requirements. do not get this if you have cox
customer_reviews.author: Dillon Dains

customer_reviews.title: WiFi password incorrect.
customer_reviews.text: Works excellent for a wired connection. As for wireless I get an error WiFi password incorrect. Will return Update: I received my Asus cm-32. Although this item is docsis 3.0 I was maxed out at wired and my WiFi is much stable and speeds are way better than Netgear. Way cheaper as well. No WiFi password incorrect and processor is intel.
customer_reviews.author: kensys1

customer_reviews.title: good router
customer_reviews.text: I had problems with this router at the begining but got them solved with Netgears help and now I can pull 1.2 Gbps on wifi 6
customer_reviews.author: Carson

customer_reviews.title: RIPOFF/ NO CUSTOMER SERVICE
customer_reviews.text: DO NOT BUY! Neat gear makes you pay for customer service. They won’t help you at all after 3 months of owning their product and will make you pay MONTHLY for customer service. I’ve never experienced that with a company. This is a rip off. Further I’ve had this for three months and despite have 1G internet speeds the WiFi has only gotten up to 200Mbps. Definitely not worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Jack M. 19 Year Amazonian

customer_reviews.title: Drop signal like 20 times a day
customer_reviews.text: This is the second time I try to write a review if let me finished, the signal is excellent when it works, but I hate to reset it or turn Off/On like 20 times a day if your ISP provider is Spectrum do not buy it, Netgear and Spectrum blame each other on solving my problem, I got no help at all, and I been told from both side in very polite way that is not there !@#$%^ problem, so I was done talking to this people, I will not recommend buying this unit. I hope one day both fix their issues. in the meantime, screw me $300.
customer_reviews.author: Eddie

customer_reviews.title: Buy it, you will not be disappointed!!!
customer_reviews.text: This is a must if your streaming video with more then one device. The range of the wifi is phenomenal as it reaches into my garage. No need for extenders or another router. Easy to set up. Had it up and running in short order. The admin screen is full of tweaks to play with.
customer_reviews.author: robert brockmeyer

customer_reviews.title: I'm sad :(
customer_reviews.text: Ugh!! I just paid my cable provider $40 to help me install it., I tried netgear's customer service for allmost 2 hours, on the phone. All we did was reset it over and over. I wanted this thing to work so bad. Especially when I paying for a Gig of service. I spent 2 days trying to install it on 8/21/20 ugh!!! I'm returning it to amazon. I'm sad :(
customer_reviews.author: jimmywenger

customer_reviews.title: Works for about 10 minutes
customer_reviews.text: Work incredible for 5 minutes stopped complete reset needed, worked for 10 minutes and was fantastic... Failed three more repeated fails after 5 to 10 minutes. Now it will not keep a WiFi network active at all. Huge expensive disappointment. Returning unit.
customer_reviews.author: Brenton Whitten

customer_reviews.title: Streaming TV Problems Eliminated
customer_reviews.text: I stream TV and had nothing but problems with broken signal with other modems. This modem eliminated those problems and also eliminated problems with other devices slow internet connections. Highly recommend this modem.
customer_reviews.author: MJB

customer_reviews.title: Incredible device
customer_reviews.text: This is a beast of a device. Yes it's expensive, but I was having lots of trouble with my Zito Media router/modem. I decided to upgrade and see if things improve. I can report setup is extremely simple, the signal is great, and holy crap the range on this thing is unreal. Down the hill from my house about 75 feet still got a usable wifi signal. Buy it.
customer_reviews.author: DM

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money
customer_reviews.text: The wifi constantly disconnected from devices. The application is decent however the speed test within the app didn't work. This is not worth the money and to many software issues. Avoid like the plague.
customer_reviews.author: S W

customer_reviews.title: Strong signal
customer_reviews.text: It's the strongest cable wireless router that I have used to date and I have used several. Footprint is a bit large and intimidating and I did find a spot for it in a corner. Reaches all points in a 2000 square-foot single floor apartment. I still get some drops on the Wi-Fi signal and an inability to connect but generally it performs very very well
customer_reviews.author: RobertCBoston

customer_reviews.title: Awesome modem/router product!
customer_reviews.text: My Netgear modem/router is a great product! Wish the price was a little less, but it works great with our Xfinity internet service! We cut the cord and just kept Xfinity's internet service! Works great with our Amazon firestick and YouTube TV services!
customer_reviews.author: Steven Br

customer_reviews.title: Didn't deliver wifi speed as expected
customer_reviews.text: 3 stars for Amazon delivery. The product arrived the next day, but it came in the original product box. No packaging. Fortunately there was no damage to the product. 3 stars for the product. I have a 500 Mbps service from Cox which actually delivers about 300 Mbps. The WiFi signal in the same room is about 230 Mbps and three rooms away is about 150 Mbps. I spent about two hours on three different phone calls with Netgear techs. They asked me to change the channels, reset the modem a few times. Still no substantial improvement. I don't know what else to do. I am disappointed the product is under performing.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Do Not Buy For Comcast
customer_reviews.text: A waste of money for Comcast customers. Will constantly drop signal/connection for your devices. Netgear will blame Comcast. Comcast will blame Netgear. You will pull your hair out in frustration why it will be working fine one moment, and be an over priced paper weight the next.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Newton

customer_reviews.title: Horrible customer service
customer_reviews.text: Last time I gave them my information to try to get help to set up my router they sold it and I got a bunch of phone calls and emails I called with just one simple question to get some help again and I don’t want to give my information out because they sell it so much last time this happened they wouldn’t even help me so I gave him a dummy email and I get tons of emails a day
customer_reviews.author: Matthew the Rv guy

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product overall. I’ll definitely recommend this product.
customer_reviews.text: Great Product By Obed Agyemang 12345 I love this NETGEAR Nighthawk Cable Modem WiFi 6 Router Combo (CAX80). It works great with xfinity. I downloaded the netgear app and set it up all by myself without contacting Comcast. I love the parental control feature in the app. My kids are home doing virtual learning and it was very difficult to keep tract of their internet use. With this app I’m able to control when they use the internet. I am running all my devices (Apple tv, laptops, TV, printer, phones) with increased signal strength. I love the wireless speed increase and sleek design. Excellent product overall. I’ll definitely recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Need to call Cox to authorize modem
customer_reviews.text: It required a call to Cox to authorize the modem. I do not have any better Internet speed but the modem router is stable. There was a firmware update from Netgear ready as soon as I was connected through Cox to the Internet. This is one of my biggest reasons to have my own device, i.e., firmware updates for security and stability updates. Also, with tax, it knocked $15 off of my monthly bill.
customer_reviews.author: Rory S.

customer_reviews.title: Works perfectly with Xfinity!
customer_reviews.text: Works perfectly with Xfinity. I was apprehensive, but went ahead and bought this. I hate renting and wanted to make sure I had the best. The Xfinity installer was really impressed and said, "that's a great one."
customer_reviews.author: Tim T.

customer_reviews.title: Too much for nothing
customer_reviews.text: Ordered for $400. Been trying to get it connected since August 1st. During setup always says to download and install from app. App says it's not supported. There's supposed to be a sticker to scan on the back to help during install. There isn't one. Now it's past the cutoff to return. Tried having cable guy help, but he can't see it until the app or access to it is figured out. The customer service chat always disconnects when I try netgear customer service, then I have to start again with another agent. So not worth the headache that comes with this.
customer_reviews.author: Jen

customer_reviews.title: Love the Wi-Fi strength.
customer_reviews.text: Works great. Had to call Spectrum to finish getting setup. Still have use spectrum router but at least don’t have pay the fee to rent modem (I’m not teach savvy so believe got components correct of router bs modem) Very easy to setup different networks. We use three different connections two have passwords one doesn’t. We have 1.5 story house and have no problems with Wi-Fi signal upstairs.
customer_reviews.author: BigCountrySwtP

customer_reviews.title: Finally
customer_reviews.text: After struggling to get other Netgear products to work with Cox’s panorama modem, I finally returned both devices and replaced them with this and were finally seeing the performance I expect. While struggling with support from both companies was difficult, I must say that the Netgear folks were pretty good. Happy with this so far (though it is quite pricey).
customer_reviews.author: NN

customer_reviews.title: It supports a lot of accessories
customer_reviews.text: Can't find anything I don't like about this thing. I really not tech. savvy. I bought this based on my internet and security provider's recommendations. This WiFi runs everything as promised. It works: my computer works, it supports my security app, I'm happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: William

customer_reviews.title: Definitely recommend
customer_reviews.text: This definitely made a big difference in our WiFi speed and would definitely recommend it to anyone. I never give 5 stars because I feel there is always a way to make things better. I did not need technical support but I gave them a 4 star assuming they’re as good as the product. It is expensive but I don’t my paying for a great product.
customer_reviews.author: Jric

customer_reviews.title: Not reliable
customer_reviews.text: After only a few months of use, this router suddenly started intermittently dropping the connection with Xfinity and I have to turn the router off & back on to get the internet to work again. Xfinity says the signal to the house is strong and the latest firmware is installed on the router. Waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Kristof V.

customer_reviews.title: DEFECTIVE.  Dead on arrival and Does not work with Xfinity
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this modem on amazon on December 2019. It clearly stated that it works on Comcast/Xfinity. I have been having no luck to get this modem to work whatsoever, I spent countless hours with tech support from Xfinity via telephone without any success. They even sent a tech to the house in order to check everything out. Xfinity checked their signals which are working fine. The modem light for internet kept on blinking despite multiple resets. I believe that I received a defective product from netgear/amazon. I have the purchase history from amazon. Let me make it clear, the modem did not work from the get go. It is DEFECTIVE!!! Garbage modem!
customer_reviews.author: jaelle

customer_reviews.title: This review is not of the product but for the seller "EverythingOnUs".
customer_reviews.text: Do not purchase from the seller EverythingOnUs. I purchased 2 Netgear C7800 and received 2 defective, refurbished modems at the price of new ones. They waisted not only my time but the Comcast technicians trying to get them to work.
customer_reviews.author: G.Rose

customer_reviews.title: Fast, but unstable. Not usable
customer_reviews.text: This modem/router had serious problems for me. After a few days the connection started dropping every day or two. After a couple weeks, it was happening every few hours. I initially though it was a faulty device. An idea that was confirmed by NETGEAR support. Got a replacement through Amazon and ended up with the same problem. None of the solutions offered by NETGEAR support made any difference. Finally after fighting to try to make it work for 2 months I gave up. Amazon was kind enough to provide a full refund. I ended up buying a Motorola modem and have had zero issues for about a month now. Dont buy this device!
customer_reviews.author: Will

customer_reviews.title: COX SERVICE AND NETGEAR NIGHTHAWK
customer_reviews.text: I noticed that I was paying the same price as my internet plan as Gigablast. I decided to upgrade my service. I ordered that modem, but was advertised as up to 2gps wifi speed which is wrong, I made speed test with Lan connected cable it hit to 600mps, and wifi speed did not pass 175mps, I called customer service of Netgear, :) they told me to call COX customer service, what can they with my router wifi speed, their modem getting 600mps rate but giving only 175mps. :) , I will return and get one cox provided one for the short term. I remember my old Netgear experience. I should have remembered before buying their product.
customer_reviews.author: Onbaran

customer_reviews.title: Strong Signal Over 2200 Sq. Ft.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent "Netgear Genie" browser portal to monitor and set up devices & security. Basement office placement using onboard Ethernet ports via Xfinity 1000Mbps service yield 935Mbps. Ground level Laptops and Nvidia Shield receiving 560Mbps over wireless 5G and the 2nd floor bedroom laptops & Fire Stick yielding 235Mbps. Good 2-story coverage from the basement. Our iPhones stay on our 2G network when we're on the neighbors patio 2nd house away. We tried 2 other less expensive models and stepped up the ladder to this model's uncompromised service point. AAA+++ service for a 2200 sq. ft. home.
customer_reviews.author: David A. Celani

customer_reviews.title: Cheaper one it might work way better than those fancy ones,
customer_reviews.text: I had a good internet around 860 mbps I got the cable modem wireless that I hear it is good and make the internet work better, no after I start to use my internet didn’t get 500 mbps I try all the set up but the internet was slow and dropping a lot, I gave up I returned the product and bought a cheaper one that is just cable modem still netgear way cheaper and way better my internet now get 985 mbps and works very well my new cable modem is the MC1000, 3.1
customer_reviews.author: Henrique & Allen

product_meta.title: NETGEAR Nighthawk Cable Modem WiFi Router Combo (C7800) - Compatible with Cable Providers Including Xfinity by Comcast, Cox, Spectrum | Cable Plans Up to 2 Gigabits | AC3200 WiFi Speed | DOCSIS 3.1
product_meta.description: Style:2000Mbps Max Download | WiFi AC3200| Pattern Name:SingleThe Nighthawk X4S AC3200 Wi-Fi DOCSIS 3. 1 Cable Modem Router with 32x8 channel bonding delivers up to 3. 2Gbps Wi-Fi speeds even during peak hours.
feature_bullets: Processor—Powerful 1.5GHz dual core processor boosts wireless, wired, and WAN-to-LAN
Beamforming+—Boosts speed, reliability, & range of WiFi connections

Compatible with all major cable internet providers: Including certification by Xfinity by Comcast and COX. NOT compatible with Spectrum, Verizon, AT&T, CenturyLink, DSL providers, DirecTV, DISH and any bundled voice service.
Save monthly rental fees: Model C7800 replaces your cable modem and WiFi router saving you up to $168/yr in equipment rental fees.
Built for ultimate speed: best for cable provider plans up to 2 gigabits speed.
Fast wifi performance: Get up to 3000 sq ft wireless coverage and 45 devices connected with AC3200 speed (up to 3200 Mbps).
Versatile connections: 4 Gigabit Ethernet ports and 2 hi-speed USB 3.0 ports give you fast wired connections to your computer, printer, game box, storage drive, and other devices.
Modem technology: Engineered with 32x8 channel bonding and DOCSIS 3.1.
Safe & secure: Includes parental controls, and supports WEP and WPA/WPA2 wireless security protocols.

specifications.Wireless Type: 5 GHz Radio Frequency, 2.4 GHz Radio Frequency
specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.3 out of 5 stars9,010 ratings4.3 out of 5 stars
